title: What were the different schools and theories related to animal magnetism in the 19th century?
first_phrase: This part of the text discusses the various schools and theories that emerged within the field of animal magnetism. The author mentions some key figures like Puységur, Grimes, Reichenbach, and Donato, who each made significant contributions to the field. Donato, in particular, is noted as the first to use new techniques to magnetize healthy individuals. However, the author laments that Donato did not study the method systematically, leaving that task to others like Dr. Brémaud. The overall message is that while animal magnetism had some real and valuable physio-psychological effects, it was often confused and distorted by fanatics and charlatans.
content: Ainsi Puységur (1784) découvre le somnambulisme magnétique mais le laisse tomber dans le domaine des'charlatans sous le nom mystique de clairvoyance. Grimes (1848) découvre la suggestion vocale dans l’état de veille mais la submerge dans son hypothèse absurde de ï’électro-biologie. Reichenbach (1860) voit le premier la subtilité de la perception dans les magnétisés, mais l’obscurcit avec sa théorie de la force odique ou odism'c. Donato (1875) est le premier qui délaisse les sujets habituels, c’est-à-dire les hystériques, et, en appliquant de nouveaux procédés, il est le premier qui magnétise des individus sains, qui se présentent spontanément ; il renouvelle, d’après les enchanteurs anciens et orientaux, la méthode de la fascination, exercée sur des personnes en l’état de veille ; niais, je le regrette pour lui, il ne l’étudie pas méthodiquement et laisse à d’autres, c’est-à-dire au docteur Brémaud, le soin d’en donner une description, et une explication physiologique, en se servant pourtant d’individus déjà fascinés par Donato (1).
last_phrase: In conclusion, the history of animal magnetism, or mesmerism, is filled with various discoveries, theories and superstitions ranging from clairvoyance, suggestion, and odic forces, to spiritualism and vital fluid. Despite the many obscurities and absurdities, a few individuals like Donato have made methodical efforts and applied new techniques to advance the study of magnetism. Today, while many of these theories may seem outdated or irrelevant, the study of magnetism still holds potential for future discoveries in the field of physio-psychology.
